title: The Subacute Toxicity of Perfluorooctane Sulfonate and/or Perfluorooctanoic Acid and Legacy Aqueous Film‐Forming Foams to Japanese Quail (Coturnix japonica) Chicks
reasoning: The abstract compares the toxicity of PFOS, PFOA, their combination, and two legacy aqueous film-forming foams (3M AFFF and Ansul AFFF) in Japanese quail chicks. It reports that Ansul AFFF, which contains 6:2 fluorotelomer thioamido sulfonate, did not result in any mortalities, whereas PFOA and PFOS caused significant mortality. This indicates that Ansul AFFF is safer than PFOA and thus presents a safer alternative.

title: Fluorination of Boron-Doped Diamond Film Electrodes for Minimization of Perchlorate Formation.
reasoning: The abstract describes a boron-doped diamond (BDD) electrode functionalized with a 1H,1H,2H,2H-perfluorodecyltrichlorosilane self-assembled monolayer that drastically reduces perchlorate (ClO4-) formation compared to unmodified BDD electrodes. Although perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA) is mentioned as a fluorination method, the silanized BDD electrode shows a 99.85-99.94% decrease in perchlorate formation rates, indicating a significant safety advantage by minimizing a harmful byproduct. This suggests the silanized BDD electrode is a safer alternative to PFOA in this context.

target_chemical_harm.rationale: The reasoning text does not explicitly state any harms or hazards related to perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA).
